articles.description: Australia bowl out West Indies for just 27 - the second lowest score in Test history, and the worst since 1955 - to complete a 176-run win.
articles.title: West Indies score 27 as Australia's Mitchell Starc takes quickest five-wicket Test haul

articles.description: Brentford sign England midfielder and former Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson on a two-year contract following his recent departure from Ajax.
articles.title: Brentford transfers: Jordan Henderson signs on two-year deal

articles.description: Ben Stokes extracted every last ounce from England and himself to lead his country to another memorable win at Lord's, writes Stephan Shemilt.
articles.title: How Ben Stokes led England to victory over India six years on from World Cup final success

articles.description: BBC Sport F1 correspondent Andrew Benson answers your latest questions.
articles.title: F1 Q&A: Christian Horner, Red Bull, Verstappens, Alpine, Hulkenberg, Sauber and wet tyres

articles.description: All the latest transfer news as Newcastle make a move to sign Eintracht Frankfurt striker Hugo Ekitike, plus a Q&A with our football reporters.
articles.title: Transfer news: Ekitike to Newcastle latest plus reporters Q&A coming up

articles.description: Manchester City extend their kit partnership with Puma for at least 10 years, with the contract understood to be worth a minimum of £1bn, making it the largest deal in the Premier League.
articles.title: Man City agree Premier League record £1bn kit deal

articles.description: Is British and Irish Lions wing Mack Hansen fit for Saturday's first Test against Australia or not? Tom English tries to make sense of the mixed messages coming out of the Lions camp.
articles.title: British and Irish Lions 2025: Mack Hansen's fitness raises questions before first Test

articles.description: English putting coach Phil Kenyon discusses his work with Scottie Scheffler and the adjustments the pros need to make when putting on links greens at this week's Open Championship.
articles.title: The Open at Royal Portrush: How Scottie Scheffler's putting fortunes were turned around

articles.description: BBC Sport analyses how England's Euro 2025 group-stage performance compares to how they performed in the opening round at Euro 2022.
articles.title: England Women: How Lionesses' Euro 2025 performance compares to 2022

articles.description: Rory McIlroy says he is ready to embrace playing a home Open Championship and is happy to "have another crack" at Royal Portrush after missing the cut in 2019.
articles.title: The Open 2025: Rory McIlroy says Portrush win would be 'just as emotional' as Masters triumph
